decks.notes: The deck focuses on aggressively lowering your own life total to pump up powerful creatures like Death's Shadow and Scourge of the Skyclaves. It also includes a variety of spells like Thoughtseize and Lightning Bolt to disrupt your opponent's game plan while protecting your creatures with cards like Apostle's Blessing and Dismember. The deck features a low mana curve and utilizes Mishra's Bauble for card advantage, allowing you to efficiently close out games with cards like Temur Battle Rage and Kolaghan's Command.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of powerful planeswalkers and versatile spells. It utilizes cards like Jace, Teferi, and Uro to generate card advantage and disrupt opponents, while also running removal like Path to Exile and Lightning Bolt to deal with threats. The deck aims to control the board with counterspells like Cryptic Command and Force of Negation, while ramping up its own resources with cards like Growth Spiral and Omnath. The land base is designed to provide flexibility and support the various colors needed for spells and activations.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources while efficiently ramping up mana to cast powerful multicolored spells. The key strategy is to use cards like Niv-Mizzet Reborn and Bring to Light to access a wide range of threats and answers, while also generating value with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Wrenn and Six. The inclusion of versatile removal spells and disruptive planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler helps to maintain control of the game until the deck can overwhelm the opponent with its diverse threats and powerful synergies.

This deck focuses on utilizing the combo of Deceiver Exarch and Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker to generate infinite copies of Deceiver Exarch, allowing for multiple untaps and potentially game-winning plays. The deck also includes a mix of control elements such as counterspells and removal spells to protect the combo and disrupt opponents. Utilizing card draw and filtering with spells like Serum Visions and Opt helps to find key pieces of the combo. Overall, the strategy revolves around assembling the combo and securing the win through overwhelming board presence and control.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells like Remand, Mana Leak, and Cryptic Command, along with hand disruption with Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. It also includes removal spells such as Fatal Push and Bloodchief's Thirst to deal with threats on the board. The deck has card advantage engines like Narset, Parter of Veils and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to help maintain control. The mana base is built for consistency and includes utility lands like Mystic Sanctuary and Field of Ruin.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with low-cost aggressive creatures like Stormwing Entity, Sprite Dragon, and Monastery Swiftspear. Spells like Burst Lightning, Lightning Bolt, and Lava Dart provide additional direct damage and removal to clear the way for the creatures to attack. Card draw and mana ramp are provided by spells like Opt, Manamorphose, and Light Up the Stage to maintain a steady stream of threats. The deck is designed to win as fast as possible by maximizing damage output and aggressively pressuring opponents.

This deck focuses on setting up a board state where players have to sacrifice their permanents and discard their hands, while the controller of the deck can bypass these effects with cards like Electrodominance and As Foretold. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating value through cards like Ancestral Vision and Crashing Footfalls. The deck also includes some control elements with cards like Force of Negation and Lightning Bolt to help stabilize the board and protect its combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to create a favorable board state and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful combo interactions.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play Primeval Titan and trigger Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle's ability to deal damage to the opponent. Dryad of the Ilysian Grove helps to fix mana and allow Valakut to trigger off any land, while Elvish Reclaimer can tutor for key lands. The deck also includes a small toolbox of creatures like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Skyclave Apparition for utility. Field of the Dead provides additional threats, and Path to Exile offers removal. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of land triggers and powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing cheap spells and creatures to deal quick and efficient damage to the opponent. By playing aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Soul-Scar Mage, and Stormwing Entity, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart, the deck aims to win the game as fast as possible. The inclusion of cards like Opt, Manamorphose, and Light Up the Stage helps maintain card advantage and ensure a steady flow of threats. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Brazen Borrower to handle opposing threats and maintain pressure on the opponent.

This aggro deck focuses on maximizing the power of Death's Shadow by quickly reducing your own life total and deploying threats that scale with it. Utilizing disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, along with efficient removal like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to control the board while deploying aggressive threats like Monastery Swiftspear and Scourge of the Skyclaves. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional recursion and value throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to establish early game control through cards like Utopia Sprawl and Blood Moon, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Glorybringer to pressure the opponent. The inclusion of Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Wrenn and Six adds additional card advantage and removal options. Klothys, God of Destiny provides both lifegain and graveyard hate, while Seasoned Pyromancer helps to generate card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing its own threats to win the game.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent with aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while also utilizing burn spells like Lava Spike, Rift Bolt, and Lightning Bolt to finish off the opponent. The spells in the deck also have additional effects that can prevent the opponent from gaining life or dealing extra damage, allowing for a fast and efficient path to victory. The mana base is designed to support the fast-paced gameplay of the deck, with a mix of fetch lands and shock lands to ensure consistency in casting spells.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. It also includes a suite of counterspells and removal spells to deal with threats efficiently. The deck aims to out-value the opponent by gaining card advantage with Snapcaster Mage and overwhelming them with tokens from Shark Typhoon. With a mana base that supports all three colors of Jeskai, the deck is designed to control the pace of the game and ultimately win through powerful synergies and incremental advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly play aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while also dealing direct damage with spells like Lava Spike and Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with damage before they can stabilize. Eidolon of the Great Revel punishes the opponent for casting spells, while Boros Charm provides versatility and protection. The deck also utilizes the companion Lurrus of the Dream-Den to bring back key creatures or spells from the graveyard for extra value.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays using low-cost creatures like Death's Shadow and Monastery Swiftspear to quickly deal damage to the opponent. With a mix of discard spells like Thoughtseize and removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure on the board. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional flexibility and recursion of key cards from the graveyard. The deck's strategy revolves around balancing aggression with control to outpace and outlast the opponent.

The main idea of this Modern Aggro Red Deck Wins deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and burn spells. By playing aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Bonecrusher Giant, alongside powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Flame Slash, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Supporting cards like Abbot of Keral Keep and Seasoned Pyromancer provide additional value and card advantage, while cards like Blood Moon disrupt the opponent's mana base. The goal is to pressure the opponent early and close out the game before they can recover.
